quote: i love you.
i still care.
some apologies come too late. after the damage is already done. after the bridges have burned.
i'm starting to think i'm the problem. why can't anyone stay? what's wrong with me?
i'm tired of explaining my trauma. sometimes i just want someone to sit with me in silence and understand.
i wonder if i'm lovable. or if i'm just something people tolerate until something better comes along.
i'm scared of wanting love. because wanting means risking being told i'm not enough. again.
i'm tired of being the person who loves more. who wants more. who hurts more.
i'm sorry i was the wrong person. i'm sorry i couldn't be what you needed. i'm sorry i was me.
i know i'm the reason things fell apart. i destroy everything i touch. you deserved better than me.
i'm trying to believe that my absence is a gift. that letting me go was the best thing you could do.
i'm trying to forgive myself. but some days, that feels like the hardest thing in the world.
i'm scared i'm becoming the person who loves so hard they forget how to love themselves.
i'm tired of explaining my pain to people who will never understand.
i'm trying to rebuild myself. but some parts of me are still waiting for you to come home.
i'm learning that loving someone doesn't always mean they'll love you back. sometimes it just means hurting alone.
everything reminds me of you. the coffee mug. that song. the way silence sounds exactly like your goodbye.
i wonder if you think about me. or if i'm just another story you've already finished.
i replay our last conversation in my head. over and over. looking for something i missed.
i collect the moments you didn't choose me. they're heavy. but i'm learning to put them down.
sometimes i catch myself reaching for my phone. to tell you something. before remembering you're gone.
your laugh still echoes in my mind.
i’m not worth your love. never was.
i wish i could undo it all. start over.
no one can fill your place. ever.
maybe in another life, i’d know how to love you right.
I’m sorry for all the things I didn’t say. for the love I didn’t show when I had the chance.
the memory of your touch grows colder each day. but I still reach for it.
